courses.subject: ENVS
courses.courseTitle: SPECIAL TOPICS IN ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE AND STUDIES
courses.description: Study of a special topic related to Environmental Science and Studies. The topic will vary and will be announced. This course may be repeated if a different topic is covered.

courses.subject: ENVS
courses.courseTitle: ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION AND SERVICE LEARNING IN THE TROPICS
courses.description: Designed for majors in Science or Education with an interest in Environmental Education. Coursework will take place in Costa Rica, emphasizing tropical forest ecology concepts applicable to PreK-12 environmental education and management of tropical natural resources. Cross-listed as BIOL 382.

courses.subject: ENVS
courses.courseTitle: WATER POLICIES OF THE UNITED STATES
courses.description: History and application of the Clean Water Act, including ongoing actions and case studies with a focus on Maryland issues.

courses.subject: ENVS
courses.description: Analysis of the scientific approach to solving environmental problems within the socioeconomic concerns involved in formulating and administering environmental policy. Topics include energy, management, policy, and sustainability.

courses.subject: ENVS
courses.courseTitle: SCIENCE AND POLICY OF THE CHESAPEAKE BAY RESTORATION
courses.description: Provides students with a basic understanding of the key physical, chemical, and biological processes in the Chesapeake Bay, with a focus on restoration and management efforts.

courses.subject: ENVS
courses.courseTitle: SPECIAL TOPICS IN ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE AND STUDIES
courses.description: Study of a special topic related to Environmental Science and Studies. Topic can vary and will be announced. May be repeated if a different topic is covered.

courses.subject: ENVS
courses.courseTitle: INDEPENDENT STUDY IN ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE AND STUDIES
courses.description: Studies in selected content areas tailored to student needs. This course may be repeated for a total of 3 credits.
prerequisites: completion of 30 credit hours of required ESS coursework

courses.subject: ENVS
courses.description: Independent investigation of an environmental problem under the guidance of a faculty member. Paper and public presentation required.

courses.subject: ENVS
courses.description: Practical application of environmental science through a supervised work experience with a business, industry, or agency. Requires analytical final product integrating workplace experience with academic studies.

courses.subject: ENVS
courses.description: Synthesis, analysis, and application of environmental science information from various perspectives.
prerequisites: completion of Advanced Writing Seminar requirement
